intro: Dalechampia magnoliifolia, commonly known as the magnolia leaf eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has palmately lobed leaves that resemble those of magnolia trees, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. The botanical features of Dalechampia magnoliifolia make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
